title: Authors and Citation

title: Authors and Citation
text: Zhu G (2023). SparseEnv: Fit Sparse Envelope Model Envelope based Sparse PLS.. R package version 0.0.1.
code: @Manual{,   title = {SparseEnv: Fit Sparse Envelope Model and Envelope based Sparse PLS.},   author = {Guangyu Zhu},   year = {2023},   note = {R package version 0.0.1}, }

title: Fit Sparse Envelope Model and Envelope based Sparse PLS.
text: SparseEnv versatile statistical tool implements advanced techniques two influential papers: “Sparse Envelope Model: Efficient Estimation Response Variable Selection Multivariate Linear Regression” published Biometrika (103, 579-593)1. “Envelope-based sparse partial least squares” published Annals Statistics (48, 161-182) February 20202. papers provide theoretical foundation SparseEnv, bridges theory practice, offering comprehensive framework efficient estimation response variable selection multivariate linear regression.

title: Fit Sparse Envelope Model and Envelope based Sparse PLS.
Berkeley guidance data — Berkeley
text: Berkeley guidance data (Tuddenham Snyder, 1953) includes height measurements 39 boys 54 girls born 1928-1929 Berkeley, CA.

title: Berkeley guidance data — Berkeley
Berkeley guidance data — Berkeley
text: X X=1 boy, X=0 girl. Y Height measurements 31 ages.

title: Berkeley guidance data — Berkeley
text: Tuddenham, R. D. M. M. Snyder (1953). Physical growth California boys girls birth eighteen years. Publications child development. University California, Berkeley 1(2), 183–364.

title: SAT score data — SAT
text: average SAT score fifty states U.S. 1982, well six variables used predict average SAT score.

title: SAT score data — SAT
SAT score data — SAT
text: data frame contains following components: sat SAT score; takers percentage total eligible students state took exam; income median income families test takers; years average number years test takers formal studies social sciences, natural sciences, humanities; public percentage test takers attended public secondary schools; expend total state expenditure secondary schools; rank median percentile ranking test takers within secondary school classes.

title: SAT score data — SAT
text: Ramsey, F. Schafer, D. (2012). Statistical Sleuth: Course Methods Data Analysis. Boston: Cengage Learning.

title: SAT score data — SAT
text: SAT score data.

title: SAT score data — SAT
code: data(SAT) SAT = as.data.frame(scale(SAT, scale = FALSE)) new = model.matrix(sat ~ (takers + income + years + public + expend + rank)^2, SAT) X = as.matrix(new[, c(2:22)]) Y = as.matrix(SAT[, 1]) m1 = spxenv(X, Y, u = 3)

what: Asyptotic covariance of vec(beta) for a fitted envelope model. — asym.env
title: Asyptotic covariance of vec(beta) for a fitted envelope model. — asym.env
text: function computes asymptotic covariance vec(beta) asymptotic standard error elements beta fitted envelope model.

title: Asyptotic covariance of vec(beta) for a fitted envelope model. — asym.env
Asyptotic covariance of vec(beta) for a fitted envelope model. — asym.env
text: object fitted env object.

title: Asyptotic covariance of vec(beta) for a fitted envelope model. — asym.env
text: covMatrix asymptotic covariance vec(beta). rp rp matrix. covariance matrix returned asymptotic. actual standard errors, multiply 1/n. asySE asymptotic standard error elements beta envelope model. r p matrix. standard errors returned asymptotic, actual standard errors, multiply 1/sqrt(n). ratio asymptotic standard error ratio standard multivariate linear regression estimator envelope estimator, element beta. r p matrix.

title: Asyptotic covariance of vec(beta) for a fitted envelope model. — asym.env
text: Cook, R. Dennis, Bing Li, Francesca Chiaromonte. "Envelope models parsimonious efficient multivariate linear regression." Statist. Sinica 20 (2010): 927-1010.

what: Choose u for envelope model. — choose_env
title: Choose u for envelope model. — choose_env
text: Select dimension envelope subspace using Bayesian information criterion, Akaike information criterion, Likelihood ratio testing.

title: Choose u for envelope model. — choose_env
Choose u for envelope model. — choose_env
text: X Predictors. n p matrix, p number predictors. predictors can univariate multivariate, discrete continuous. Y Multivariate responses. n r matrix, r number responses n number observations. responses must continuous variables. dims vector. dimensions chosen . default 0 r. maxiter Maximum number iterations. Default value: 100. ftol Tolerance parameter F. Default value: 1e-2. verbose Flag print model fitting process, logical 0 1. Default value: 0.

title: Choose u for envelope model. — choose_env
text: result Dimensions envelope subspace chosen BIC, AIC, LRT(0.05), LRT(0.01). detail -2*Loglik, BIC, AIC, degrees freedom, p-values LRT test.

title: Choose u for envelope model. — choose_env
text: codes implemented based algorithm Section 4.3 Cook et al (2010). Cook, R. Dennis, Bing Li, Francesca Chiaromonte. "Envelope models parsimonious efficient multivariate linear regression." Statist. Sinica 20 (2010): 927-1010.

title: Choose u for envelope model. — choose_env

title: Choose u for the envelope-based PLS. — choose_xenv
Choose u for the envelope-based PLS. — choose_xenv
text: X Predictors. n p matrix, p number predictors. predictors can univariate multivariate, discrete continuous. Y Multivariate responses. n r matrix, r number responses n number observations. responses must continuous variables. dims vector. dimensions chosen . default 0 p. maxiter Maximum number iterations. Default value: 100. ftol Tolerance parameter F. Default value: 1e-2. verbose Flag print model fitting process, logical 0 1. Default value: 0.

title: Choose u for the envelope-based PLS. — choose_xenv
text: result Dimensions envelope subspace chosen BIC, AIC, LRT. detail -2*Loglik, BIC, AIC, degrees freedom, p-values LRT test.

title: Choose u for the envelope-based PLS. — choose_xenv
text: codes implemented based algorithm 4.5.1 Cook et al (2012). Cook, R. Dennis, . S. Helland, Zhihua Su. "Envelopes partial least squares regression." Journal Royal Statistical Society Series B 20 (2012): 927-1010. Grassmann manifold optimization step implements algorithm sg_min 2.4.3 Ross Lippert (http://web.mit.edu/~ripper/www.sgmin.html).

title: Choose u for the envelope-based PLS. — choose_xenv
code: data(AIS) #> Warning: data set ‘AIS’ not found choose_xenv(AIS$X, AIS$Y) #> Error in eval(expr, envir, enclos): object 'AIS' not found

title: Fit the envelope model. — env
text: function fits envelope model responses predictors, using maximum likelihood estimation. dimension envelope 1 r-1, implemented algorithm Cook et al. (2016). dimension r, envelope model degenerates standard multivariate linear regression. dimension 0, means X Y uncorrelated, fitting different.

title: Fit the envelope model. — env
code: env(X, Y, u, init = NULL, ftol = 0.01, maxiter = 100, verbose = 0)

title: Fit the envelope model. — env
text: X Predictors. n p matrix, p number predictors. predictors can univariate multivariate, discrete continuous. Y Multivariate responses. n r matrix, r number responses n number observations. responses must continuous variables. u Dimension envelope. integer 0 r. init initial value envelope subspace. r u matrix. Default value one generated function initial_value. ftol Tolerance parameter F. Default value: 1e-2. maxiter Maximum number iterations. Default value: 100. verbose Flag print model fitting process, logical 0 1. Default value: 0.

title: Fit the envelope model. — env
text: alpha estimated intercept envelope model. r 1 vector. beta envelope estimator regression coefficients. r p matrix. Gamma orthogonal basis envelope subspace. r u semi-orthogonal matrix. Gamma0 orthogonal basis complement envelope subspace. r r-u semi-orthogonal matrix. eta coordinates beta respect Gamma. u p matrix. Sigma envelope estimator error covariance matrix. r r matrix. Omega coordinates Sigma respect Gamma. u u matrix. Omega0 coordinates Sigma respect Gamma0. r-u r-u matrix. loglik maximized log likelihood function. real number. paramNum number parameters envelope model. positive integer. sigRes sample error covariance matrix. r r matrix. sigY sample response covariance matrix. r r matrix. sigX sample predictor covariance matrix. p p matrix. n number observations data. positive integer. r number responses. nonnegative integer. u Dimension envelope. integer 0 r. p number predictors. positive integer. fit_time time costs fitting envelope model.

title: Fit the envelope model. — env
text: Cook, R. Dennis, Bing Li, Francesca Chiaromonte. "Envelope models parsimonious efficient multivariate linear regression." Statist. Sinica 20 (2010): 927-1010. codes implemented based algorithm Cook, R. D., Forzani, L. Su, Z. (2016), Note Fast Envelope Estimation. Journal Multivariate Analysis. 150, 42-54.

title: Fit the sparse envelope model. — spenv
text: X Predictors. n p matrix, p number predictors. predictors can univariate multivariate, discrete continuous. Y Multivariate responses. n r matrix, r number responses n number observations. responses must continuous variables. u Dimension envelope. integer 0 r. lambda1 user-supplied lambda sequence first stage. lambda2 user-supplied lambda sequence second stage. ftol Tolerance parameter F. Default value: 1e-4. maxiter Maximum number iterations. Default value: 100. verbose Flag printing model fitting process, logical 0 1. Default value: 0. init initial value envelope subspace. r u matrix. default value one generated function initial_value.

title: Fit the sparse envelope model. — spenv
text: alpha estimated intercept envelope model. r 1 vector. beta envelope estimator regression coefficients. r p matrix. Gamma orthogonal basis envelope subspace. r u semi-orthogonal matrix. Gamma0 orthogonal basis complement envelope subspace. r r-u semi-orthogonal matrix. eta coordinates beta respect Gamma. u p matrix. Sigma envelope estimator error covariance matrix. r r matrix. Omega coordinates Sigma respect Gamma. u u matrix. Omega0 coordinates Sigma respect Gamma0. r-u r-u matrix. loglik maximized log likelihood function. real number. paramNum number parameters envelope model. positive integer. sigRes sample error covariance matrix. r r matrix. sigY sample response covariance matrix. r r matrix. sigX sample predictor covariance matrix. p p matrix. n number observations data. positive integer. r number responses. nonnegative integer. u Dimension envelope. integer 0 r. p number predictors. positive integer. q number active responses. positive integer. where_1 active responses chosen sparse envelope model. where_0 inactive responses chosen sparse envelope model. lambda tuning parameters chosen BIC. BIC_seq1 sequence BIC first stage. BIC_seq2 sequence BIC second stage. fit_time time costs fitting sparse envelope model.

title: Fit the sparse envelope model. — spenv
text: function fits sparse envelope model responses using maximum likelihood estimation. dimension envelope 1 r-1, implement algorithm Su Z, Zhu G, Chen X, Yang Y (2016). dimension r, envelope model degenerates standard multivariate linear regression. dimension 0, means X Y uncorrelated, fitting different.

title: Fit the sparse envelope model. — spenv
text: codes implemented based algorithm Su, Z., Zhu, G., Chen, X., Yang, Y. (2016), Sparse Envelope Model: Efficient Estimation Response Variable Selection Multivariate Linear Regression. Biometrika. 103, 579-593.

title: Fit the envelope based sparse partial least squares model. — spxenv
code: spxenv(   X,   Y,   u,   lambda1 = NULL,   lambda2 = NULL,   ftol = 0.01,   maxiter = 100,   eps2 = 1e-04,   init = NULL,   asy = 0,   verbose = 0,   init_method = 1,   lambda_spice = 0.1 )

title: Fit the envelope based sparse partial least squares model. — spxenv
text: X Predictors. n p matrix, p number predictors. predictors can univariate multivariate, discrete continuous. Y Multivariate responses. n r matrix, r number responses n number observations. responses must continuous variables. u Dimension envelope. integer 0 p. lambda1 user supplied lambda sequence first stage. lambda2 user supplied lambda sequence second stage. ftol Tolerance parameter F. Default value: 1e-4. maxiter Maximum number iterations. Default value: 100. init initial value envelope subspace. p u matrix. Default value one generated function initial_value. verbose Flag print model fitting process, logical 0 1. Default value: 0. asym Flag calculating asymptotic covariance vec(beta) asymptotic standard error elements beta fitted envelope model, logical 0 1. Default value: 0.

title: Fit the envelope based sparse partial least squares model. — spxenv
text: mu estimated intercept envelope model. r 1 vector. beta envelope estimator regression coefficients beta. p r matrix. Gamma orthogonal basis envelope subspace. p u semi-orthogonal matrix. Gamma0 orthogonal basis complement envelope subspace. p p-u semi-orthogonal matrix. eta coordinates beta respect Gamma. u r matrix. SigX envelope estimator covariance matrix X. p p matrix. Omega coordinates Sigma respect Gamma. u u matrix. Omega0 coordinates Sigma respect Gamma0. p-u p-u matrix. sigYcX estimated conditional covariance matrix Y given X. r r matrix. loglik maximized log likelihood function. real number. paramNum number parameters envelope model. positive integer. n number observations data. positive integer. q number active response variables. positive integer. iternum number iterations. positive integer. lambda tuning parameters chosen BIC. where_1 active responses chosen sparse envelope model. where_0 inactive responses chosen sparse envelope model. BIC_seq1 sequence BIC first stage. BIC_seq2 sequence BIC second stage. covMatrix asymptotic covariance vec(beta). pr pr matrix. covariance matrix returned asymptotic. actual standard errors, multiply 1/n. asySE asymptotic standard error elements beta envelope model. p r matrix. standard errors returned asymptotic, actual standard errors, multiply 1/sqrt(n). ratio asymptotic standard error ratio standard multivariate linear regression estimator envelope estimator, element beta. r p matrix. fit_time time costs fitting envelope model.

title: Fit the envelope based sparse partial least squares model. — spxenv
text: function fits sparse envelope model predictor using maximum likelihood estimation. dimension envelope 1 p-1, implemented algorithm G. Zhu Z. Su (2017). dimension p, envelope model degenerates standard multivariate linear regression. dimension 0, means X Y uncorrelated, fitting different.

title: Wheat Protein Data — wheatprotein
text: protein content ground wheat samples.

title: Wheat Protein Data — wheatprotein
Wheat Protein Data — wheatprotein
text: data frame 50 observations following 8 variables: V1 V6 Measurements reflectance NIR radiation wheat samples 6 wavelengths range 1680-2310 nm. measurements made log(1/reflectance) scale. V7 protein content sample (percent). V8 Binary indicator, 0 high protein content 1 low protein content. cutoff point protein content smaller 9.75.

title: Wheat Protein Data — wheatprotein
text: Wheat Protein Data. data result experiment calibrate near infrared reflectance (NIR) instrument measuring protein content ground wheat samples. protein content sample (percent) measured standard Kjeldahl method. Fearn (1983), problem find linear combination measurements predicts protein content. estimated coefficients can entered instrument allowing protein content future samples read directly. first 24 cases used calibration, last 26 samples used prediction.

title: Wheat Protein Data — wheatprotein
text: Fearn, T. (1983). misuse ridge regression calibration near infrared reflectance instrument.

title: Wheat Protein Data — wheatprotein
